intro: Lindernia thyridostoma, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Lindernia thyridostoma is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
